subject: Automobile Racing
lead_paragraph: Ryan Newman captured a pole at Lowe’s Motor Speedway in Concord, N.C., for the seventh time when he knocked Jimmie Johnson off the top spot with a speed of 189.394 miles an hour in qualifying for the Bank of America 500. Johnson, who has won 5 of the past 12 races at Lowe’s, will start second after a lap of 188.990 for tomorrow night’s race.
